content:

author: anonymous

comments.content:
Here is a sample of Benguiat Charisma Script from the Script Guide:   
 ![Charisma Sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114044229im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47259.gif)

Mike, I think this is Gaston, you can check it in the Solotype Catalog (p. 101) and it is in the [Dover Bold Script Display Fonts CD](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114044229/http:/store.yahoo.com/doverpublications/0486999769.html).

You're absolutely right, about the font and the Dover CD. It's shown in full in the 'Bold Script Alphabets' book by Dover too. I just didn't look far enough. I knew it wasn't a match, but I saw it was close, and thought it might be close enough.   
   
Good catch Ignacio!
Thought I'd mention that Castcraft lists an [Opti version](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114044229/http:/www.castcraft-software.com/designer4/designer4.06.html) of Gaston.

It's very similar to a film type called Benguiat Charisma, which was once included in the Expresiv Photolettering Font Collection put out by Tiger Direct in the mid-90's.   
   
The intial letters are a lot like [E+F Candice](http://web.archive.org/web/20141114044229/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/candice/), but Charisma's lower case is more like this sample. I may have a sample of Charisma in my Script Guide, and I will post it if I do.
